content.question: The fuel consumption of a car, in miles per gallon (mpg), is modeled by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>F</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>s</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mi>s</mi> <mrow> <mn>20</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>âˆ’</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>s</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2400</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4714@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where s is the speed of the car, in miles per hour. If the car is traveling at 50 miles per hour and its speed is changing at the rate of 20 miles/hour2 what is the rate at which its fuel consumption is changing?

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
